file_content.text: Head for Coruscant. Garza will want to see you ASAP.
Welcome back to the loving arms of the Republic, Prellon. It's good to see you.
Good to see you, too, Jonas. Your friend got me out with all limbs intact--guess that means I owe you twenty credits, huh?
Ah, Captain... you brighten my day, fatten my bank account and gun down Imps like maimed banthas. Marry me when this war is over.
We'll stick to drinks for now. You know how to find me.
[Flirt] Not so fast.
Sounds like a plan.
Don't get your hopes up, Jonas.
You're ridiculous.
You know me--nothing but dreams and aspirations.
All right, all right. Knock it off, kids--we've got business to discuss.
That's what you get for betting against the best, Prellon.
We can chat later. I want to know about the Gauntlet.
Let's get to the intel.
Yeah, we'd better get down to business.
I appreciate the vote of confidence.
Thanks, Jonas.
It was hardly fair, really, since I'd already seen you in action. Now why don't you tell us what this is all about, Prellon?
I think I earned those credits, Jonas.
Where's my cut of the profit?
Fine, fine, I'll share the wealth. Now, Prellon, why don't you tell us what we went to all of this trouble to learn?
The Gauntlet--the Empire's new superweapon. It's a massive cannon, built into the frame of an Imperial battle cruiser.
But it's no ordinary cannon. The Gauntlet can fire on ships traveling through hyperspace, where they're completely helpless. Warships go down in one shot.
A weapon that powerful could win the war by itself.
That's a serious threat.
Exactly. We have to move fast to stop this thing.
Do you know the effective range? Is it mobile?
What else did you learn?
Range is high, but not infinite--it can hit anything in the same star system. And it isn't mobile yet, but that's their goal.
How do we attack a weapon that can hit ships in hyperspace?
We're doomed.
Beats me. Let's just hope the people up top figure out something fast.
I've got a full report ready. Once Jonas gets me to a terminal, I'll send the details to General Garza.
You'd better head back to Coruscant, Captain. Garza will have Prellon's report by the time you get there, and I'm sure she'll want to keep Havoc Squad in the loop.
I'll head for Coruscant immediately.
Understood.
Nothing is ever simple, is it?
This is one party I won't mind seeing the end of.
The Imps have a gun that can shoot me right out of hyperspace! I'm not going anywhere!
I can't risk traveling!
The Gauntlet is being hidden in a remote star system until it's completely operational. You're okay for travel from here to Coruscant.
Take care, Captain.
Best of luck, Captain.
Captain, good to see you. It was a big relief to hear that Havoc could make it out for this one.
Congratulations on the promotion, by the way. How's it feel to be so big and important?
If being a captain lets me do more for the Republic, that's all that matters.
Just part of the job.
Well, you look good. Authoritative.
I tell people what I want, and they do it. Just the way I like it.
[Flirt] I like being the boss.
I knew I should've signed up for the army.
Any way to skip the flirting and tell us what we're here for, Balkar?
You may be jealous... but you're also right. We need to get moving on this one.
With respect, Captain, couldn't this private discussion continue after our mission is complete?
I hate to say it, but you're probably right. Time isn't exactly on our side on this one.
If you are interested in transferring to a career that more directly defends our freedoms, any nearby recruitment station could provide the necessary documents!
I'll definitely think about it, Forex. But we'd better get this op out of the way, first.
More pay, more people I can order around--there's no downside.
I like being the boss.
Well, when you're at the top of the Republic military someday, feel free to have me stationed somewhere cushy.
Spare me the chit-chat, Jonas. We've got work to do.
Like you're wasting my time.
So, you know that you're extracting an undercover agent who has intel on the Empire's new superweapon, code-named "Gauntlet."
The agent's name is Prellon Garn. He's done his part. The transport he's riding just made an emergency landing in the desert under "mysterious circumstances."
I'll find the landing site and pull our man out ASAP.
Understood.
I don't follow you. Is the agent alright?
Huh?
He's fine. He sabotaged the ship so that they'd have to touch down and to give us an opportunity to pull him out.
If your guy is already on the ground, why doesn't he just come here?
So what do you need me for?
I think the Imperials might wonder why one of their people wants to wander off into the desert alone.
Garn's ride was an Imperial troop transport, so expect plenty of security as you approach.
Once our agent is secure, be sure the scene is clear and make your way back. Good luck.
